title: Creamy Garlic Parmesan Risotto
excerpt: A luxurious, creamy risotto packed with garlic and parmesan flavors that's perfect for a cozy dinner.
content:
This creamy garlic parmesan risotto is the ultimate comfort food. With its rich flavor and velvety texture, it's guaranteed to impress even the most discerning dinner guests.

Ingredients

  • 1 1/2 cups Arborio rice
  • 6 cups chicken broth, warmed
  • 1 cup dry white wine
  • 1 medium onion, finely diced
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 3 tbsp butter
  • 1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese
  • Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
  • 2 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped

Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil and 1 tbsp of butter over medium heat.
  2. Add the onion and sauté until translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
  3. Add the garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
  4. Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat with the oil and butter. Toast the rice for about 2 minutes.
  5. Pour in the white wine and stir until it's almost completely absorbed.
  6. Begin adding the warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring frequently. Wait until each addition is almost completely absorbed before adding more.
  7. Continue this process until the rice is creamy and al dente, about 18-20 minutes.
  8. Remove from heat and stir in the remaining butter and Parmesan cheese.
  9. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  10. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

Serve immediately for the best texture and flavor. This risotto pairs beautifully with grilled chicken or a simple green salad.

title: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken
excerpt: A quick and flavorful Thai stir-fry with chicken, basil, and a perfect balance of sweet, salty, and spicy.
content:
This Thai Basil Chicken (Pad Krapow Gai) is a beloved Thai street food dish known for its bold flavors and quick preparation. With the perfect mix of savory sauces and fresh basil, it’s a dish that’s both satisfying and exhilarating.

Ingredients

  • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 3 Thai chilies (adjust to taste), finely chopped
  • 300g chicken breast or thigh, minced or finely chopped
  • 1 small onion, sliced
  • 1 bell pepper, sliced
  • 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 teaspoon fish sauce
  • 1/2 teaspoon sugar
  • 1/2 cup Thai basil leaves
  • Steamed jasmine rice, for serving
  • Fried egg (optional), for topping

Instructions

  1. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat.
  2. Add garlic and chilies and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
  3. Add chicken and cook until it's no longer pink, breaking it apart as it cooks.
  4. Add the onion and bell pepper, stir-frying for another 2–3 minutes until slightly tender.
  5. Stir in the oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, and sugar. Mix well to coat everything evenly.
  6. Turn off the heat and stir in the fresh basil leaves until wilted.
  7. Serve hot over steamed jasmine rice and top with a fried egg if desired.

This dish is best enjoyed fresh, with cooling slices of cucumber and a wedge of lime on the side.

title: Classic French Apple Tart
excerpt: An elegant French dessert featuring buttery pastry and spiral-arranged caramelized apples.
content:
This beautiful French Apple Tart combines a buttery, crisp pastry with thinly sliced caramelized apples arranged in an elegant spiral pattern. Perfect for any special occasion or to impress your guests with a classic French dessert.

Ingredients

  • 1 sheet puff pastry or sweet tart dough
  • 4 large apples (such as Golden Delicious or Granny Smith), peeled, cored, and thinly sliced
  • 1/2 cup sugar
  • 3 tbsp unsalted butter, melted
  • 2 tbsp apricot jam (optional, for glaze)
  • 1 tsp ground cinnamon (optional)
  • Juice of half a lemon

Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
  2. Roll out the puff pastry or tart dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
  3. Brush the surface lightly with melted butter.
  4. Toss the apple slices with lemon juice, sugar, and cinnamon (if using) to prevent browning and add flavor.
  5. Arrange the apple slices in concentric circles, starting from the outer edge and working your way to the center, overlapping each slice slightly.
  6. Brush the apples with more melted butter to help caramelize during baking.
  7. Bake in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the pastry is golden brown.
  8. Remove from the oven and brush with warmed apricot jam for a shiny glaze, if desired.
  9. Allow the tart to cool slightly before slicing and serving.

This tart pairs wonderfully with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream for an extra indulgent treat.

title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
excerpt: A refreshing, protein-packed salad full of Mediterranean flavors and colorful vegetables.
content:
This vibrant Mediterranean Quinoa Salad is packed with protein, fiber, and bold Mediterranean flavors. It’s perfect for meal prep, potlucks, or a refreshing lunch on a warm day.

Ingredients

  • 1 cup uncooked quinoa
  • 2 cups water or vegetable broth
  • 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
  • 1 cucumber, diced
  • 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
  • 1/2 cup Kalamata olives, sliced
  • 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
  • 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
  • 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
  • 2 tbsp fresh lemon juice
  • 1 garlic clove, minced
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions

  1. Rinse the quinoa under cold water. In a saucepan, combine quinoa and water or broth and bring to a boil.
  2. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and let cool.
  3. In a large bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, feta, and parsley.
  4. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.
  5. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
  6. Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving for best flavor.

Serve as a main dish or as a flavorful side. This salad keeps well in the fridge for up to 3 days.
tags: salad, healthy, mediterranean, vegetarian, meal prep

title: Homemade Sourdough Bread
excerpt: Learn to make incredible sourdough bread with a crispy crust and tender, flavorful interior.
content:
Making your own sourdough bread is a rewarding process that results in a delicious loaf with a crispy crust and tender crumb, perfect for sandwiches or to enjoy on its own.

Ingredients

  • 1/4 cup sourdough starter
  • 3 1/2 cups bread flour
  • 1 1/4 cups water
  • 1 1/2 tsp salt

Instructions

  1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sourdough starter, water, and flour. Mix until a rough dough forms.
  2. Cover and let rest (autolyse) for 30 minutes.
  3. Add salt and knead until incorporated. Perform 4 sets of stretch and folds every 30 minutes over the next 2 hours.
  4. Cover the bowl and let the dough bulk ferment at room temperature for 4–6 hours until doubled.
  5. Turn the dough onto a floured surface, shape it into a round loaf, and place it in a floured proofing basket.
  6. Cover and refrigerate overnight for cold proofing (8–12 hours).
  7. Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C) with a Dutch oven inside.
  8. Score the loaf and bake in the Dutch oven for 20 minutes with the lid on, then 25 minutes uncovered until golden brown.
  9. Let the bread cool on a wire rack for at least 1 hour before slicing.

This rustic sourdough is perfect for toast, sandwiches, or enjoying with a spread of butter and sea salt.
